intro: Peltandra, commonly known as the arrowleaf or swamp lily, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and striking, spadix-bearing inflorescences. Peltandra species are typically found in wetland environments, such as marshes and swamps, where they thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The plants often have a short, stout rhizome and produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Due to their ecological importance and ornamental value, some species of Peltandra are cultivated in wetland gardens and conservation areas.
